intro: Mentzelia jonesii, commonly known as Jones' blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branching stems and showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Mentzelia jonesii is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
